title: Hello World
description: Standing up the website, and saying hello...
contents:
It’s time to stand up a little website to share the results of my explorations into “data ignota”, the digital edition I’ve been creating of Ada Palmer’s Terra Ignota series. This is that website.
Since the ship I’ve launched on that digital ocean is built from R, it makes sense to build this site from the same timber. After some research, I’ve decided to use the distill package as the primary tool, and to publish via Github Pages.
What It Took to Get Here:

Create public repo at: https://github.com/syvwlch/Data-Ignota

Clone repo to R project (using Github Desktop, not R studio)

Create Distill blog within project

Add/update content

Build site & preview locally

Push to github

Setup github pages

Site is up at: https://syvwlch.github.io/Data-Ignota/

Add base_url: key to site.yml (used for RSS feed and share cards)
Lessons Learned
Always Be Knitting (your posts)
The distill package automatically builds web pages except for posts like this one. This is done to keep the build fast and to protect posts which might have dependencies from breaking later. So for posts it’s not enough to hit save, you have to reknit them on purpose.
